nodes.text:
function fromSecp256k1<Account.fromSecp256k1.Options>(privateKey: Hex, options?: Account.fromSecp256k1.Options | undefined): Account.RootAccount
namespace fromSecp256k1
nodes.docs: Instantiates an Account from a Secp256k1 private key.
tags:
```ts
import { Account } from 'viem/tempo'

const account = Account.fromSecp256k1('0x...')
```

nodes.docs:
Generates an ECDSA P256 key pair that includes:

- a `privateKey` of type [`CryptoKey`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CryptoKey)

- a `publicKey` of type 
{@link 
ox#Hex .Hex
}
 or 
{@link 
ox#Bytes .Bytes
}
tags: options - Options for creating the key pair.

nodes.docs: Instantiates an Account from a P256 private key.
Unix timestamp when key expires (0 = never expires).
An intrinsic object that provides basic mathematics functionality and constants.
Returns the greatest integer less than or equal to its numeric argument.
Enables basic storage and retrieval of dates and times.
Returns the number of milliseconds elapsed since midnight, January 1, 1970 Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).

Creates, signs, and sends a new transaction to the network synchronously.
Returns the transaction receipt.

- Docs: https://viem.sh/docs/actions/wallet/sendTransactionSync
- Examples: https://stackblitz.com/github/wevm/viem/tree/main/examples/transactions_sending-transactions
- JSON-RPC Methods:
  - JSON-RPC Accounts: [`eth_sendTransaction`](https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/apis/json-rpc/#eth_sendtransaction)
  - Local Accounts: [`eth_sendRawTransaction`](https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/apis/json-rpc/#eth_sendrawtransaction)

virtualFiles.content:
// @filename: viem.config.ts
import { createClient, http, publicActions, walletActions } from 'viem'
import { privateKeyToAccount } from 'viem/accounts'
import { tempoModerato } from 'viem/chains'
import { tempoActions } from 'viem/tempo'

export const client = createClient({
  account: privateKeyToAccount('0x...'),
  chain: tempoModerato,
  transport: http(),
})
  .extend(publicActions)
  .extend(walletActions)
  .extend(tempoActions())
